title: About - What's New
content:
About

Checkout

What's New




Instagram













About









Mia Moore, Jewelry lover



“The more I learn about jewelry and dive into its history, the more I love it. Getting to know the meanings behind objects in particular moments in time, how they translated into status, wealth or power. Jewelry has always been a way to communicate and distinguish and with the evolution of society, it turned into another way of expression, like clothing. I’m passionate about how we use it to express who we really are.”











Mia founded the blog with a group of people that shared the same passion for jewelry, its history and handcraft.









“We’re very lucky to be able to write about our passion and interview those whose work we admire.”
Marie, editor for PNDNT










The Team











Marie



Editor & Jeweler











Sandra



Writer, Editor & Jewelry Designer













Tanya



Editor & Public Relations











Ryan



Marketing & Social Media

title: Meta slider - What's New
content:
About
Cart
Checkout
Fashion
Shop

						
					
				
			



What's New




Instagram








Fashion





Meta slider

May 24, 2023





Pertimbangkanlah: Ini adalah Pasangan Paling Bergaya di Asia Mereka mengatakan bahwa dua lebih baik daripada satu—dan pasangan bergaya bisa menjadi inspirasi fashion ganda. Sebelumnya, kami melihat apa yang para influencer paling bergaya di Asia kenakan saat fashion week. Kali ini, kami melihat pasangan dari Malaysia, Singapura, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Indonesia, dan Filipina.




    
        
            
                
Premium Nylon 2-Way Laptop Bag  Rp 999.000

                
Nike Revolution  Rp 750.000

                
Alba AG8J33X1 Men Blue  Rp 2.500.000

            
        
        
    





    
        
            
                
Premium Nylon 2-Way Laptop Bag  Rp 999.000

                
Nike Revolution  Rp 750.000

                
Alba AG8J33X1 Men Blue  Rp 2.500.000

            
        
        
    




Fashion pasangan dengan pilihan desainer sangat populer, dan bisa diinterpretasikan dalam berbagai gaya, baik itu gaya jalanan, keren, atau berkelas. Ambil inspirasi dari mereka, dan Anda dan pasangan Anda bisa menjadi pasangan yang fashionable selanjutnya! Scha Alyahya & Awal Ashaari Gegap gempita bisa menarik dalam cinta dan gaya. Lihatlah penampilan Scha dan Awal di sini. Aktor dan pembawa acara Malaysia, Awal Ashaari, terlihat keren dengan busana hitam lengkap dengan aksesori perak minimalis. Sementara itu, istrinya—aktris Scha Alyahya—berkilau dengan busana santai klasik, celana jeans biru dan kaos putih polos, ditambah dengan tas bahu Valentino warna krim. Unsur yang serasi di sini? Kaos polos dengan potongan longgar yang terstruktur. Jane Chuck & Han Pin Berpakaian serasi tidak harus berarti persis sama. Dalam perjalanan ke Seoul baru-baru ini, influencer Malaysia Jane dan Han Pin mengenakan pakaian rajut yang nyaman. Jane tampil minimalis dengan sweater rajut biru kehijauan, sementara Han Pin memilih gaya maksimalis dengan sweater bermotif. Meskipun keduanya tidak benar-benar sama, warna-warna kalem dari busana mereka yang dipadukan dengan jeans menciptakan tampilan pasangan yang serasi. Chen Yixin & Gavin Teo Ini adalah kisah klasik perempuan bertemu laki-laki dalam kombinasi busana ini oleh influencer Singapura Chen Yixin dan penyanyi Gavin Teo. Sang perempuan terlihat feminin dalam balutan warna putih, sementara sang pria memancarkan maskulinitas dengan jaket kulit. Palet warna hitam-putih pada kedua busana mereka membuat penampilan tetap serasi sambil tetap mengikuti gaya pribadi masing-masing. Terrance Lau & Cecilia Choi Pasangan yang bersama-sama memakai Gucci jelas akan tetap bersama—seperti aktor Hong Kong Terrance Lau dan Cecilia Choi. Dalam sebuah acara baru-baru ini, mereka terlihat mengenakan busana Gucci. Keduanya tampil dengan penampilan yang sangat berbeda: Cecilia mengenakan setelan gaun berprint mencolok sementara Terrance mengenakan setelan abu-abu yang dihiasi dengan kristal. Keduanya memperlihatkan gaya maksimalis dalam gaya mereka sendiri, menambahkan keunggulan keseluruhan penampilan.

What's New

Uncategorized





Q&A with Andrew Holsen, hand maker

January 24, 2023





Andrew is a jewellery hand maker from California. His passion for the craft times back to his early days in her grandmother’s bedroom. He used to dress up with big, heavy earrings and pretend to be a grown up.



How is your process of creation?



I usually start with the moodboarding and conceptualisation of a new collection. Usually that begins way earlier when I start taking photographs and sketching silly ideas for shapes.



What inspires you?



The Earth is my biggest inspiration and influence. I like to visit crystal stores, vintage bazars and be inspired with the beauty of raw stones.

What's New




Instagram








Uncategorized





Q&A with Lana DeVito, Jewellery Designer

January 24, 2023





Lana DeVito is a jewellery designer from Boston, MA. Her passion for the craft times back to her early days in her grandmother’s bedroom. She used to dress up with big, heavy earrings and pretend to be a grown up.



How is your process of creation?



I usually start with the moodboarding and conceptualisation of a new collection. Usually that begins way earlier when I start taking photographs and sketching silly ideas for shapes.



What inspires you?



The Earth is my biggest inspiration and influence. I like to visit crystal stores, vintage bazars and be inspired with the beauty of raw stones.

title: Greek Inspirations - What's New
content:
About
Cart
Checkout
Fashion
Shop

						
					
				
			



What's New




Instagram








Uncategorized





Greek Inspirations

January 24, 2023





Before dealing with Greek jewellery of the classic period some reference must be made to the primitive and archaic ornaments that preceded it. The period and phase of Greek culture to which the primitive ornaments belong is known widely as “Mycenæan”—a title it owes to the discoveries made at Mycenæ, where in 1876 Schliemann brought to light the famous gold treasure now preserved in the National Museum at Athens. 



A characteristic motive of the decoration of these objects is the use of spiral patterns almost identical with those employed on Celtic ornaments. Besides these and other primitive exhibitions of decorative skill, we find representations of naturalistic animal forms, such as cuttlefish, starfish, butterflies, and other creatures. 



These are displayed in repoussé patterns worked in low relief. Among the most notable objects are a number of gold crowns usually in the form of elongated oval plates ornamented with fine work chiefly in the shape of rosettes and spirals.



The Goddess Fashion








Mourning jewellery was usually set with pearls, garnets, or more often jet. The last, until a short while ago, was in universal favour, and was fashioned into all sorts of ornaments. It fortunately now meets with but little demand. 



The custom of wearing ornaments composed of such sombre and unpleasing material has now to all intents and purposes ceased, though it is carried on to a certain extent in France, where ouvrages en cheveux in the form of bracelets and lockets are still worn as précieux souvenirs de famille. 



After the middle of the nineteenth century the use of mourning rings and other memorial jewellery began to die out.



The goddess Fashion, who throughout all ages has waged war on the productions of the goldsmith, has laid a heavier hand on these than on any other forms of personal ornament—a circumstance which accounts for the survival at the present day of a comparatively small proportion of the enormous quantity of objects of this description that must formerly have been produced. 






“Of earrings, on the other hand, a considerable number of examples have survived. French and English portraits show at first only a large pear-shaped pearl in each ear.”
In “Jewellery” by H. Clifford Smith





Most families from time to time have consigned to the melting-pot accumulations of these memorials of their predecessors; and those who have been long in the jeweller’s business confess to the hundreds of such relics that they have broken up. It is to be hoped that the present-day revival may lead to the preservation of what remain of these quaint mementoes of our frail mortality.
